Summarise the daily precipitation data  # to monthly means: the result is a new CFVariable in a new group. pr_mon <- pr$summarise("pr_month", sum, "month") pr_mon$group #> <CF Group> [-14] / (virtual) #> Path      : /  # Add pr_mon to the new data set my_ds$add_variable(pr_mon) my_ds$variables() #> $pr_month #> <Variable> pr_month  #>  #> Values: [8.9e-05 ... 513.1605] mm #>     NA: 0 (0.0%) #>  #> Axes: #>  axis name long_name length values                                        #>  T    time           12     [2023-01-16T12:00:00 ... 2023-12-16T12:00:00] #>  X    lon  Longitude 14     [5.625 ... 14.765625]                         #>  Y    lat  Latitude  14     [40.35078 ... 49.47356]                       #>  unit                  #>  days since 1850-01-01 #>  degrees_east          #>  degrees_north         #>  #> Attributes: #>  name         type      length value               #>  actual_range NC_DOUBLE 2      8.9e-05, 513.160452 #>  units        NC_CHAR   2      mm

Median     Mean  3rd Qu.     Max. #> t2m [K] 288.2335 293.2838 294.7573 294.9324 296.6282 301.2081 #> dimension(s): #>           from to                  offset   delta    refsys x/y #> longitude    1  7                   28.85     0.1 OGC:CRS84 [x] #> latitude     1 11                   -0.95    -0.1 OGC:CRS84 [y] #> time         1  6 2016-01-01 09:00:00 UTC 1 hours   POSIXct

what: Easy Access to NetCDF Files with CF Metadata Conventions
title: Easy Access to NetCDF Files with CF Metadata Conventions
text: ncdfCF package provides easy use interface netCDF resources R, either local files remotely THREDDS server. built RNetCDF package , like package ncdf4, provides basic interface netcdf library, lacks intuitive user interface. Package ncdfCF provides high-level interface using functions methods familiar R user. reads structural metadata also attributes upon opening resource. process, ncdfCF package also applies CF Metadata Conventions interpret data.

title: Easy Access to NetCDF Files with CF Metadata Conventions
text: Opening inspecting contents netCDF resource straightforward: can convert suitable R object CFVariable instance quite easily. R objects supported include arrays, matrices vectors type logical, integer, numeric logical. R object dimnames set, used create informed axes. interestingly, array represents spatial data can give dimnames appropriate names (“lat”, “lon”, “latitude”, “longitude”, case-insensitive) corresponding axis created (coordinate values dimnames within domain axis type). “time” coordinates, automatically detected irrespective name. can modify resulting CFVariable setting properties, attributes coordinate reference system. object complete, can export save . detailed operations options given package web site.
code: library(ncdfCF)  # Get any netCDF file fn <- system.file("extdata", "ERA5land_Rwanda_20160101.nc", package = "ncdfCF")  # Open the file, all metadata is read (ds <- open_ncdf(fn)) #> <Dataset> ERA5land_Rwanda_20160101  #> Resource   : /Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Versions/4.5-arm64/Resources/library/ncdfCF/extdata/ERA5land_Rwanda_20160101.nc  #> Format     : offset64  #> Collection : Generic netCDF data  #> Conventions: CF-1.6  #>  #> Variables: #>  name long_name             units data_type axes                      #>  t2m  2 metre temperature   K     NC_DOUBLE longitude, latitude, time #>  pev  Potential evaporation m     NC_DOUBLE longitude, latitude, time #>  tp   Total precipitation   m     NC_DOUBLE longitude, latitude, time #>  #> Attributes: #>  name        type    length value                              #>  Conventions NC_CHAR  6     CF-1.6                             #>  history     NC_CHAR 34     Attributes simplified for example. # Note the use of named dimnames: these will become the names of the axes arr <- array(rnorm(120), dim = c(6, 5, 4)) dimnames(arr) <- list(lat = c(45, 44, 43, 42, 41, 40), lon = c(0, 1, 2, 3, 4),                        time = c("2025-07-01", "2025-07-02", "2025-07-03", "2025-07-04"))  (obj <- as_CF("a_new_CF_object", arr)) #> <Variable> a_new_CF_object  #>  #> Values: [-2.59647 ... 2.487776]  #>     NA: 0 (0.0%) #>  #> Axes: #>  axis name length values                      unit                           #>  Y    lat  6      [45 ... 40]                 degrees_north                  #>  X    lon  5      [0 ... 4]                   degrees_east                   #>  T    time 4      [2025-07-01 ... 2025-07-04] days since 1970-01-01T00:00:00 #>  #> Attributes: #>  name         type      length value              #>  actual_range NC_DOUBLE 2      -2.59647, 2.487776  # Axes are of a specific type and have basic attributes set obj$axes[["lat"]] #> <Latitude axis> [-2] lat #> Length     : 6 #> Axis       : Y  #> Coordinates: 45, 44, 43, 42, 41, 40 (degrees_north) #> Bounds     : (not set) #>  #> Attributes: #>  name          type      length value         #>  actual_range  NC_DOUBLE  2     40, 45        #>  axis          NC_CHAR    1     Y             #>  standard_name NC_CHAR    8     latitude      #>  units         NC_CHAR   13     degrees_north  obj$axes[["time"]] #> <Time axis> [-4] time #> Length     : 4 #> Axis       : T  #> Calendar   : standard  #> Range      : 2025-07-01 ... 2025-07-04 (days)  #> Bounds     : (not set)  #>  #> Attributes: #>  name          type      length value                          #>  actual_range  NC_DOUBLE  2     20270, 20273                   #>  axis          NC_CHAR    1     T                              #>  standard_name NC_CHAR    4     time                           #>  units         NC_CHAR   30     days since 1970-01-01T00:00:00 #>  calendar      NC_CHAR    8     standard

title: Easy Access to NetCDF Files with CF Metadata Conventions
text: Package ncdfCF still developed. supports reading data objects netCDF resources “classic” “netcdf4” formats; can write data variables back netCDF file. CF Metadata Conventions supports identification axes, interpretation “time” axis, name resolution using groups, cell boundary information, auxiliary coordinate variables, labels, cell measures, attributes grid mapping information, among others. Development plans near future focus supporting features:

title: ncdfCF: Easy Access to NetCDF Files and Interpreting with CF Metadata Conventions — ncdfCF-package
text: Support accessing interpreting netCDF datasets familiar R style. Built top RNetCDF package, built maintained developers netcdf library, package ncdfCF provides high-level access netCDF resources. Resources matched Climate Forecast (CF) Metadata Conventions climate forecasting data, current version 1.13. CF Metadata Conventions widely used distributing files climate observations projections, including Coupled Model Intercomparison Project (CMIP) data used climate change scientists Intergovernmental Panel Climate Change (IPCC), well large collections satellite imagery, including Landsat MODIS.

Data variable CFVariable contains single data variable data set. contains detailed information data variable functions access data, different selection methods. title: ncdfCF 0.8.1
text: New geom_ncdf() function create geom use map composition using package ggplot2. Functionality currently limited basically tested. CFVariable$subset() subsetting “time” axis can now use abbreviated specification time = "2025-12" select data December 2025, time = c("2020-S1", "2025-S4") meteorological season data 2019-12-01 2025-11-30 (inclusive).
